data.text: Instead of a friend become not an enemy;
Extol not thyself in the counsel of thine own heart;
Thou shalt eat up thy leaves,
A wicked soul shall destroy him that hath it,
Sweet language will multiply friends:
Be in peace with many:
If thou wouldest get a friend, prove him first,
For some man is a friend for his own occasion,
And there is a friend, who being turned to enmity and strife
Again, some friend is a companion at the table,
But in thy prosperity he will be as thyself,
If thou be brought low, he will be against thee,
Separate thyself from thine enemies,
A faithful friend is a strong defence:
Nothing doth countervail a faithful friend,
A faithful friend is the medicine of life;
Whoso feareth the Lord shall direct his friendship aright:
My son, gather instruction from thy youth up:
Come unto her as one that ploweth and soweth,
She is very unpleasant to the unlearned:
She will lie upon him as a mighty stone of trial;
For wisdom is according to her name,
Give ear, my son, receive my advice,
And put thy feet into her fetters,
Bow down thy shoulder, and bear her,
Come unto her with thy whole heart,
Search, and seek, and she shall be made known unto thee:
For at the last thou shalt find her rest,
Then shall her fetters be a strong defence for thee,
For there is a golden ornament upon her,
Thou shalt put her on as a robe of honour,
My son, if thou wilt, thou shalt be taught:
If thou love to hear, thou shalt receive understanding:
Stand in the multitude of the elders;
Be willing to hear every godly discourse;
And if thou seest a man of understanding, get thee betimes unto him,
Let thy mind be upon the ordinances of the Lord,
